articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bloomberg to keep funding campaign to defeat Trump even if he's not the nominee
articles.description: Michael Bloomberg’s massive campaign and all of its staffers will continue on through the general election in November even if he loses the Democratic nomination, supporting whomever wins the nomination with the goal of defeating President Trump.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tom Steyer surges in South Carolina
articles.description: 2020 Democratic candidate, billionaire Tom Steyer is surging to second place in South Carolina, according to the latest polling from Fox News.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Pressed for credible airstrike explanation, Team Trump struggles
articles.description: The more the White House can't explain why it launched such a dangerous airstrike, the easier it is to believe the worst of all possible explanations.
articles.content: In the immediate aftermath of last week’s U.S. airstrike that killed Iranian Gen. Qassem Soleimani, touching off a crisis in the region, Donald Trump and his team had a coherent explanation for the military offensive: the mission was necessary, the Republican… [+3526 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Iranians not suddenly on the side of hardliners: Rep. Crenshaw
articles.description: Homeland Security member, Rep. Dan Crenshaw, R-Texas, says the world is safer now since the death of Gen. Soleimani. Rep. Crenshaw also discusses U.S....

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Breaking down the last jobs report of the decade
articles.description: CNBC’s Dom Chu report on the December jobs report which indicated the economy added 145,000 jobs while the unemployment rate remained low at 3.5 percent.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Job growth cooled a little as 2019 came to a close
articles.description: Ahead of today's jobs report, most projections pointed to growth in December in the ballpark of 160,000. It looks like we didn't quite reach those expectations.
articles.content:
Ahead of this morning’s jobs report, most projections pointed to growth in December in the ballpark of 160,000. It looks like we didn’t quite reach those expectations.
The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported this morning that the economy added 140,000 jobs l… [+2378 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: What could 'soon' mean for the House Speaker?
articles.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., said Thursday that she will send the articles of impeachment against the president to the Senate 'when I'm ready,' rebuffing calls from top Democrats to submit them.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Team Trump's latest Clinton investigation ending with a whimper
articles.description: At Trump's urging, the Justice Department apparently scrutinized the Clinton Foundation and Uranium One. The probe "effectively ended with no tangible results."
articles.content:
Another Clinton investigation championed by Trump comes up empty 
As recently as last week, Donald Trump addressed an evangelical audience in Miami, where the president focused his attention on his 2016 rival. Crooked Hillary, as she is affectionately known,… [+3623 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Buttigieg takes the lead in New Hampshire
articles.description: New Monmouth polling from New Hampshire shows a four-way race in the state, with Pete Buttigieg leading the Democratic field with 20 percent. The panel discusses.
